name: Basketball
rules: Players score by shooting the ball through the opponent's hoop
Dribbling is required when moving with the ball
No physical contact that impedes opponent's movement
Shot clock: 24 seconds to attempt a shot
5 fouls per player before disqualification

positions.name: Point Guard
positions.role: Primary ball handler, sets up plays

positions.name: Small Forward
positions.role: Versatile player, inside and outside game

positions.name: Center
positions.role: Tallest player, dominates the paint, blocks shots

howToPlay: Basketball is played by two teams trying to score points by shooting a ball through a 10-foot high hoop. Teams advance the ball by dribbling or passing. The team with the most points at the end wins.

name: Soccer
rules: Players cannot use hands except goalkeeper in penalty area
Offside rule: attacker must have at least 2 opponents between them and goal
Free kicks awarded for fouls
Yellow card (warning), Red card (ejection)
Corner kicks when ball crosses goal line off defending team

positions.name: Goalkeeper
positions.role: Protects the goal, only player who can use hands

positions.name: Midfielder
positions.role: Links defense and attack, controls tempo

howToPlay: Two teams of 11 players each try to score by getting the ball into the opposing team's goal. Players move the ball primarily by kicking or heading it. The team with the most goals wins.

name: Tennis
rules: Ball must bounce once before being returned
Service alternates between players each game
Point scoring: 15, 30, 40, Game (must win by 2)
Sets won by first to 6 games (must win by 2)
Let serves (touching net on serve) are replayed
howToPlay: Players hit a ball over a net into the opponent's court. Points are scored when the opponent fails to return the ball within bounds. Players must win games, sets, and ultimately the match.

name: Cricket
duration: Varies: T20 (3 hours), ODI (8 hours), Test (5 days)
rules: Batting team scores runs by hitting ball and running between wickets
Bowling team tries to dismiss batsmen
10 ways to get out: bowled, caught, LBW, run out, etc.
Each team gets specific number of overs to bat
Six runs if ball crosses boundary without bouncing

positions.name: Batsman
positions.role: Scores runs by hitting the ball

positions.name: Bowler
positions.role: Delivers the ball to get batsman out

positions.name: Wicketkeeper
positions.role: Stands behind stumps, catches ball, attempts run-outs

howToPlay: Two teams take turns batting and fielding. The batting team tries to score runs while the fielding team tries to get them out. The team with the most runs wins.

name: Swimming
rules: Different strokes: freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly
Must touch wall at end of each lap
False starts result in disqualification
Lane assignments based on qualifying times
Specific stroke rules for each style
howToPlay: Swimmers race to complete a specific distance in the fastest time. Competitions include individual events and relay races. Different strokes have specific technique requirements.

name: Volleyball
rules: Three touches maximum per side
Players rotate positions after winning serve
Ball cannot touch ground on your side
Cannot touch net during play
Rally scoring: point on every serve

positions.name: Setter
positions.role: Sets up attacks, usually second touch

howToPlay: Teams hit a ball over a net, trying to make it land in the opponent's court. Each team has three touches to return the ball. First to 25 points (must win by 2) wins the set.

name: Badminton
rules: Shuttlecock must not touch ground
Service must be hit below waist
Rally scoring to 21 points (must win by 2)
Players switch sides after each game
Service courts change after each point in doubles
howToPlay: Players use rackets to hit a shuttlecock over a net. The shuttlecock must land in the opponent's court. Points are scored when opponent fails to return or hits out of bounds.

name: Athletics (Track & Field)
rules: Sprint events: 100m, 200m, 400m
Middle distance: 800m, 1500m
Long distance: 5000m, 10000m, marathon
Field events: long jump, high jump, pole vault, shot put, discus, javelin
False starts result in disqualification
howToPlay: Track and field includes running, jumping, and throwing events. Athletes compete for fastest times or longest/highest distances. Each event has specific techniques and rules.

name: American Football
rules: Teams have 4 downs to advance 10 yards
Touchdown: 6 points, Field goal: 3 points
Each play starts with a snap from center
Forward pass allowed only from behind line of scrimmage
Clock stops on incomplete passes and out of bounds

positions.name: Linebacker
positions.role: Defensive player, stops runs and passes

howToPlay: Two teams try to advance an oval ball into the opponent's end zone. Offense has four attempts (downs) to move 10 yards. Team with most points wins.

name: Baseball
rules: 3 strikes and you're out, 4 balls is a walk
3 outs end the inning
Run scored when player touches all bases and home plate
Fly balls caught in air result in an out
Runners can be tagged out between bases

positions.name: Infielders
positions.role: Play near bases, field ground balls

positions.name: Outfielders
positions.role: Cover deep field, catch fly balls

howToPlay: Teams alternate between batting and fielding. Batters try to hit the ball and run bases. Fielders try to get batters and runners out. Team with most runs after 9 innings wins.
